entry.title: robins appear when loved ones are near
entry.summary:
Author: mikaminato

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,284Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 900

Summary: "Where is Superman?" Dick asks with a small frown. "What do you mean?" "Aren't you dating him?" Dick tilts his head with genuine curiosity. "He should be here taking care of you. I thought Superman helped people, especially his boyfriend." "What-- we-- we're not..." Bruce starts to stammer, not sure how to even answer this. "Are you and Superman in a fight?" Dick presses, eyes big, voice dropping into a hushed whisper, "Because when me and my best friend at school fight we say mean things, and then we say we're sorry."   (Or, Battinson trying to be a good parent to Dick while fighting against his feelings for Clark Kent. Dick's there to save the day.)

entry.title: Keep the Matches away from the Sunflower
entry.summary:
Author: DiamondBat

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,307Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 204

Summary: Batman and Superman have a love/hate relationship going on due to some misunderstandings and unexpressed emotions. With no other way of dealing with the unresolved tension, both of them end up on the same dating app. From there, a romance blossoms that neither of them expected or have any way of escaping.(I originally started this with Batfleck x Cavill Superman in mind and still picture this pairing strongly. However, after watching the new Superman movie, I am now conflicted and can see this working with Corensupes and whatever Batman the reader wants to pair him with. So long as that Batman is older and beefier than Corensupes.)

entry.title: A Candle or Two: Just Me and... Who?
entry.summary:
Author: 0dejm_writes0

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,324Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 55

Summary: Clark always shows up for everyone else - no matter what they need. Help on the farm, help in town, help in Metropolis, doing chores, cleaning up, staying late, taking an extra shift. Anything. He'll always be there. He always IS there. The same can't be said when it's the other way around. No one fills in for him, no one helps him out. If he's not volunteering his way in, he's forgotten. Even on his big day, no one spares a few minutes to say something. Did they forget? No, surely they couldn't have. Not again. But it's getting late, and still no texts or calls. Just pie with Ma and Pa. Again. (Or: No one remembers it's Clark's birthday besides his parents for the 3rd year in a row, and only one person comes to celebrate: Bruce)
